title: Strictly Come Dancing’s Kelvin Fletcher reveals clash with Oti Mabuse
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse have ‘come to blows’ ahead of their next Strictly Come Dancing performance.

The pair, who have been delighting BBC One viewers ever since the competition started, will be dancing the Cha Cha to Aston Merrygold’s banger, Get Stupid.

However, it seems they have been clashing behind the scenes in the build up to Saturday night’s show.

Taking to Instagram, professional dancer Oti gave fans a glimpse into how rehearsals had been going.

Advertisement

Advertisement

In a video posted on the 29-year-old’s story, she told her 294k followers: ‘It is Friday. Fantastic freaky Friday.’

After the Emmerdale actor showed off his twerking skills, he confessed: ‘It’s been a hard week. A hard week.’

Kelvin and Oti have ‘come to blows’ over their Strictly routine (Picture: BBC)

‘It’s been very emotional,’ his partner agreed, while the 35-year-old said: ‘We came to blows a few times…’

Guys, it’s just a Cha Cha, you can do this!

Oti then added: ‘We got there in the end. And I’m excited.’

While they may have clashed about the upcoming dance, the pair have definitely made up as they look closer than ever.

Kelvin is taking his Strictly stint seriously, in the hunt for this year’s Glitterball, and is hitting the gym at 5am four times a week to ‘keep the blood flowing’.

The pair are firm favourites to win Strictly Come Dancing (Picture: BBC)

That’s on top of the 12-hour rehearsals the actor completes with Oti before they’ve even stepped foot on the BBC One dancefloor.

Well, he’s doing something right as he’s one of the firm favourites to lift the Glitterball trophy after consistently impressing the judges.

And Koti even achieved the first 10s of the series with their Charleston in week three.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday, at 6.40, on BBC One.

description: Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse have ‘come to blows’ ahead of their next Strictly Come Dancing performance.
